newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa's Amlac to list on JSE on Nov 6.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's Amlac to list on JSE on Nov 6.

text.p: South African automotive refinish company Amlac will list in the stores sector of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange next month with a market capitalisation of 36 million rand, the company said.
Ahead of its debut on November 6, Amlac will privately place 3.7 million shares of its total share capital of 21-million shares, at an issue price of 165 cents each, it said in a statement.
The company forecast earnings of 19 cents a share in the year ended December 31, 1996 growing from pro-forma earnings of 9.5 cents a year ago.
Amlac said it would not be paying a dividend in the 1996 financial year. Its first pay-out will be in 1997 at a dividend cover of 3.3 times.

Amlac was formed through its operating subsidiary, Amlac Trademaster's, acquisition of the operations and assets of Amlac (Johannesburg), Amlac (Pretoria), Trade Master Tool and Paint and City Abrasives and Paint Co.
